p: Whooping cranes arrive on their wintering grounds surrounding Aransas NWR beginning in October and depart by late April. Their migratory route leads north through central Texas, Oklahoma, Kansas, and Nebraska into western South Dakota and North Dakota to the USA–Canada border (Kuyt, 1992). Their migratory route continues north‐northwest across Saskatchewan to Alberta and then north to Wood Buffalo National Park (Figure 1; Kuyt, 1992).
